title: Group B streptococcal infection
summary: Group B streptococcal infection, also known as Group B streptococcal disease or just Group B strep,[1][2] is the infection caused by the bacterium Streptococcus agalactiae (S. agalactiae) (also known as group B streptococcus or GBS).[3] GBS infection can cause serious illness and sometimes death, especially in newborns, the elderly, and people with compromised immune systems.[2]
